trans-unit.source: Provides information about a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell"></xref> to accessibility client applications.
Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications.

Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class to provide information about a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> to accessibility client applications.

Each class that represents a visual part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>—such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>—also contains a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, to accessibility client applications.
There are two ways of providing this additional information.

To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleName%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDescription%2A> property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

You should change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A> property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.

To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> classes and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.

For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> exposes its data structure by using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> values to define the data table hierarchy.

For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell"></xref> that owns this accessible object.
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the accessible object.
Gets a description of the default action of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
An empty string ("").
Performs the default action of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject.DoDefaultAction%2A> method selects the row if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullRowSelect> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.RowHeaderSelect>.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The name of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> is the same as the name of the parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Navigates to another accessible object.

The following table describes which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> owns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> that is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method.
Parameter value
Description
The first <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> in the row, not including the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> below the current row if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> has no other columns.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> above the current row.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current row is the first row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> below the current row.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current row is the last row.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation> values
`null`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> values.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents an object in the specified direction.
Gets the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject"></xref> that belongs to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow"></xref> of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Gets the role of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.RowHeader"></xref> value.
Modifies the row selection depending on the selection mode.
If the owning cell does not belong to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, no action is taken.
Otherwise, the following table describes the action performed for each flags value.
Parameter value
Action
Moves input focus to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.TakeSelection> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection.AddSelection>

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control that contains the owning cell has a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode%2A> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullRowSelect> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.RowHeaderSelect>, the row containing the cell is selected.
If the row containing the cell is selected, the selection is canceled.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection> values
No action is taken.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property value is `null`.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The return value always includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable> value.

It also includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selected> value if the associated cell is selected and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Offscreen> value if the cell is not currently displayed.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates"></xref> values.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
An empty string ("").
